notes.title: Summary
notes.text: A potential security vulnerability in the Intel® Graphics Driver installers for versions 15.40 and 15.45 may allow escalation of privilege.  Intel is not releasing updates to mitigate this potential vulnerability and has issued a product discontinuation notice for the Intel® Graphics Drivers for versions 15.40 and 15.45.

notes.title: Recommendation
notes.text:
Intel has issued a product discontinuation notice for Intel® Graphics Drivers for versions 15.40 and 15.45.  As of June 15, 2024, the Intel® Graphics Drivers for versions 15.40 and 15.45 are not supported with any additional functional, security, or other updates. Intel recommends that users of the Intel® Graphics Drivers for versions 15.40 and 15.45 uninstall it or discontinue use as soon as possible.

names: Intel would like to thank Marius Gabriel Mihai for reporting this issue. Intel, and nearly the entire technology industry, follows a disclosure practice called Coordinated Disclosure, under which a cybersecurity vulnerability is generally publicly disclosed only after mitigations are available.

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled search path in the Intel® Graphics Driver installers for versions 15.40 and 15.45 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
